medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient was in her usual state of health until three days prior to admission when she developed progressively worsening abdominal pain and vomiting. Pain was diffuse but worse in the bilateral upper quadrants, initially intermittent in nature but then became constant the day prior to admission. Patient began vomiting feces at home. Denies diarrhea or constipation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Crohn's disease (ileal, on prednisone, 6 mercaptopurine, and ?infliximab), colorectal cancer (status post resection), Type II Diabetes Mellitus, COPD, Osteoporosis, Diverticulosis, Macular Degeneration, knee surgery (2 on left), bladder sling, inguinal hernia repair (2 times).
